keywords._abstract: Introduces an abstract method; that is, a method defined by a parent class which must be implemented by a subclass.
keywords._allresults: Collects multiple results from a method or procedure invocation into a simple vector.
keywords._and: Boolean operator; result is true if both operands are true.
keywords._andif: Boolean operator equivalent to _and except that evaluation stops once the result is determined.
keywords._catch: Destination for transfer of control with a _throw statement. Can be labelled with an expression.
keywords._clone: Within a method, refers to a copy of self (the current object). Receivers _self, _super, _private and _clone
keywords._constant: In a declaration, prevents reassignment to the variable after initialisation.
keywords._continue: In a controlled or infinite loop, terminates execution of one iteration of the loop.
keywords._elif: Introduces second and subsequent condition in a conditional.
keywords._else: Introduces final block body in a conditional.
keywords._gather: In an lvalue tuple, collects all remaining values into a simple vector.
keywords._handling: Introduces statement sequence for handling a condition.
keywords._iter: Introduces an iterator method or procedure definition.
keywords._leave: Terminates execution of a block or loop.
keywords._lock: Introduces a _lock statement to gain exclusive access to an object.
keywords._loop: Introduces the body of a loop.
keywords._loopbody: Used in an iterator method or procedure to yield values to a controlled loop.
keywords._optional: In an argument list for a method or procedure definition, introduces optional arguments.
keywords._or: Boolean operator; result is true if either operand is true.
keywords._orif: Boolean operator equivalent to _or except that evaluation stops once the result is determined.
keywords._over: Introduces iterator in controlled loop statement.
keywords._package: Used at the top level to define the current package.
keywords._pragma: Introduces classification of methods, classes, global variables, shared variables and so on.
keywords._locking: _protect _locking Introduces a protected block with a lock.
keywords._protection: Introduces protection code, executed if a protected block is abandoned.
keywords._recursive: Used in a parallel variable declaration to declare the variables recursively.
keywords._return: Introduces a _return statement, returning control from a method or procedure.
keywords._scatter: In an rvalue tuple, distributes a vector into individual values.
keywords._self: Within a method, refers to the target object. Within a procedure, refers to the procedure.
keywords._super: Within a method, refers to a superclass of the target object.
keywords._throw: Introduces a _throw statement to transfer control to a matching _catch statement.
keywords._try: ntroduces a statement sequence which may give rise to particular conditions; the statements for handling a condition are introduced by _when.
keywords._when: ntroduces a list of conditions which may be raised by a _try statement.
keywords._with: ntroduces value or value list in statements such as _leave, _throw, _handling.
